paper_abstract: We propose newly constructed two-dimensional hybrid codes (2-D hybrid codes) and the corresponding system architecture for a spectral/spatial optical code division multiple access (OCDMA) system. We employ unidimensional (1-D) integer lattice codes and 1-D perfect difference codes to construct the 2-D hybrid codes. This proposed system can suppress the phase-induced intensity noise (PIIN) and has the multiuser interference (MUI) cancellation property. In comparison with the other systems using the 2-D maximal-area matrices codes (2-D MM codes), the 2-D perfect difference codes (2-D PD codes), and the 2-D spatial division multiplexing balanced incomplete block design codes (2-D S-BIBD codes), the numerical results show that the proposed system has the superior performance.
paper_title: Noncoherent Spectral/Spatial OCDMA System Using Two-Dimensional Hybrid Codes
